entry.title: The Local Government Changes for England (Council Tax) (Transitional Reduction) Regulations 1999
entry.summary: Under Part II of the Local Government Act 1992, where recommendations for changes to local government in England are made by the Local Government Commission, the Secretary of State may make an order (“a reorganisation order”).

entry.title: The Medicines (Advertising and Monitoring of Advertising) Amendment Regulations 1999
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Medicines (Advertising) Regulations 1994 (“the Advertising Regulations”) and the Medicines (Monitoring of Advertising) Regulations 1994 (“the Monitoring of Advertising Regulations”). Those Regulations contain the legislative measures necessary for implementing Council Directive 92/28/EEC concerning the advertising of medicinal products for human use (“the Advertising Directive”), and these Regulations make further provision relating to the implementation of that Directive.

entry.title: The Confirmation to Small Estates (Scotland) Order 1999
The Scottish Parliament (Regional Returning Officers) (Scotland) Order 1999
entry.summary: This Order designates persons to be the regional returning officers for each region in relation to the Scottish Parliament. The regional returning officer for each region will perform functions, conferred by or under the Scotland Act 1998 in relation to the election and return of regional members of the Scottish Parliament.

entry.title: The Education (Registered Inspectors of Schools Appeal Tribunal and Registered Nursery Education Inspectors Appeal Tribunal) (Procedure) Regulations 1999
entry.summary: These regulations replace the Education (Registered Inspectors of Schools Appeal Tribunal) (Procedure) Regulations 1994 (S.I. 1994/717) and make provision in materially the same terms for appeals against decisions of the Chief Inspector for England and the Chief Inspector for Wales conferred, on the one hand, by section 9 of the School Inspections Act 1996 and, on the other hand, by paragraph 10 of Schedule 26 to the School Standards and Framework Act 1998.

entry.title: The Social Security (Contributions) (Re-rating and National Insurance Fund Payments) Order 1999
entry.summary: This Order increases the rates of Class 2 and Class 3 contributions specified in sections 11(1) and 13(1) of the Social Security Contributions and Benefits Act 1992 (“the Act”) from £6.35 to £6.55 and from £6.25 to £6.45 respectively. It also increases from £3,590 to £3,770 the amount of earnings specified in section 11(4) below which an earner may be excepted from liability for Class 2 contributions (articles 2 and 3).

entry.title: The Non-Domestic Rates (Levying) (Scotland) Regulations 1999
entry.summary: These Regulations make provision as to the amount payable in certain circumstances as non-domestic rates in respect of property in Scotland. They apply only to financial year 1999-2000 (“the relevant year”).

entry.title: The Local Authorities (Alteration of Requisite Calculations) (England) Regulations 1999
entry.summary: Sections 32 and 43 of the Local Government Finance Act 1992 set out respectively how a billing authority and a major precepting authority are to calculate their budget requirements for a financial year, and sections 33 and 44 of that Act set out respectively how a billing authority and a major precepting authority are to calculate the basic amount of their council tax.

entry.title: The Social Security Benefits Up-rating Order 1999

category.term: SOCIAL SECURITY;TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF EMPLOYMENT

entry.title: The Personal Injuries (Civilians) Amendment Scheme 1999
entry.summary: This Scheme further amends the Personal Injuries (Civilians) Scheme 1983 (S.I. 1983/686) (“the principal Scheme”) which makes provision for the payment of pensions and allowances to or in respect of civilians who were killed or injured during the 1983–45 world War by increasing the amounts of allowances, pensions and awards payable under that Scheme and also increasing the amounts of income to be disregarded for the purposes of certain parts of the Scheme.

entry.title: The National Institute for Clinical Excellence Regulations 1999

ukm:Subject.Value: NATIONAL HEALTH SERVICE, ENGLAND AND WALES

category.term: NATIONAL HEALTH SERVICE, ENGLAND AND WALES

entry.summary: These Regulations make provision concerning the membership and procedure of the National Institute for Clinical Excellence which is a Special Health Authority established under the National Health Service Act 1977 by the National Institute for Clinical Excellence (Establishment and Constitution) Order 1999.

entry.title: The Trunk Roads (Red Route) Traffic Orders (General Variation) Order 1999
entry.summary: This Order varies each of the orders specified in its schedule by adding to the exemptions from the parking controls imposed by virtue of those orders to allow the parking of pedal cycles in facilities specifically provided for pedal cycle parking.

entry.title: The Transport of Dangerous Goods (Safety Advisers) Regulations 1999
entry.summary: These Regulations implement Council Directive 96/35/EC on the appointment and vocational qualification of safety advisers for the transport of dangerous goods by road, rail and inland waterway (OJ No. L 145, 19.6.96, p. 10).

entry.title: Deseasonalisation Premium (Protection of Payments) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1999
entry.summary: Article 4c of Council Regulation (EEC) No. 805/68 (O.J. No. L148, 28.6.68, p. 24) (O.J./S.E. 1968 (1) p. 187) (inserted by Council Regulation (EEC) No. 2066/92 (O.J. No. L 215, 30.7.92, p. 49)) as amended provides for the payment of beef and veal producers of a deseasonalisation premium. Detailed rules for the administration of the premium are laid down in Articles 1, 19 to 22, 42 to 45 and 54 to 61 of the Commission Regulation (EEC) No. 3886/92 (O.J. No. L 391, 21.12.92, p. 20) as amended.

entry.title: The Education (School Information) (Wales) (Amendment) Regulations 1999
entry.summary: Section 92(1) and (6) of the School Standards and Framework Act 1998 place local education authorities under a duty to publish such information about the admissions arrangements of maintained schools in their area in such manner as may be prescribed by regulations. Section 537 of the Education Act 1996 enables the Secretary of State by regulations to impose additional requirements relating to the publication of information.

entry.title: The Civil Courts (Amendment) Order 1999
entry.summary: This Order amends the Civil Courts Order 1983 so as to close Corby County Court on 1st March 1999.

entry.title: The Education (Aptitude for Particular Subjects) Regulations 1999
entry.summary: Section 99(3) of the School Standards and Framework Act 1998 provides that the admission arrangements for a maintained school may not make provision for selecting pupils by reference to aptitude unless the provision is for a permitted form of selection. Section 102 of the Act permits selection of pupils by reference to their aptitude for one or more particular subjects (to be prescribed by regulations) in which the school specialises. Such selection is permitted only if the proportion of pupils selected by reference to such an aptitude does not exceed a limit of 10% of those admitted to the school in the age group concerned.

entry.title: The Education (Grants for Education Support and Training) (England) Regulations 1998 (Amendment) Regulations 1999

category.term: Special educational needs and additional support

entry.summary: These Regulations further amend the Education (Grants for Education Support and Training) (England) Regulations 1998. They add three new purposes for or in connection with which grants are payable. The new purposes relate to training for numeracy consultants and leading mathematics teachers, out of school hours literacy and numeracy classes for pupils in the final year of key stage 2 and the provision of portable CD Rom systems to education authorities to aid school management and curriculum support for pupils with special educational needs.

entry.title: The Education (Objections to Admission Arrangements) Regulations 1999
entry.summary: Section 90 of the School Standards and Framework Act 1998 enables objections to be referred to the adjudicator or (in Wales) the Secretary of State about admission arrangements for maintained schools which have been determined under section 89 of the Act. Objections may be made by the admission authorities for other maintained schools and, in certain circumstances, by parents.

entry.title: The Water (Compulsory Works Powers) (Notice) Regulations 1999
